Description: Body sherd (rejoined from two fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above two white concentric bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of female figure (only torso and arms of female figure dressed in chiton with black with red patches and possible himation remaining; raising right arm and holding wreath in her left hand), to left; graffito inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the Group of Worshippers. According to her, part of a komos scene is depicted. The leading vase from this group is the St Petersburg chalice from Berezan (Lemos 1991, no. 964). Most of the vases in this group display a mixture of techniques consisting of portraying female figures in outline and dancing komasts in black figure.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 126, p. 131, p. 291, no. 891, pl. 120)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1147) (phase 2)
